intro: Haplopappus juarezensis, commonly known as the Juárez's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy, white pappus structures, which aid in wind dispersal of its seeds. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Haplopappus juarezensis is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in desert ecosystems.
